description: Detects the use of Ngrok, a utility used for port forwarding and tunneling, often used by threat actors to make local protected services publicly available. Involved domains are bin.equinox.io for download and *.ngrok.io for connections.
false_positives: Another tool that uses the command line switches of Ngrok
name: Ngrok Usage
query: (process.command_line.text:(*\ tcp\ 139* OR *\ tcp\ 445* OR *\ tcp\ 3389* OR *\ tcp\ 5985* OR *\ tcp\ 5986*) OR (process.command_line.text:*\ start\ * AND process.command_line.text:*\-\-all* AND process.command_line.text:*\-\-config* AND process.command_line.text:*.yml*) OR (process.executable.text:*ngrok.exe AND process.command_line.text:(*\ tcp\ * OR *\ http\ * OR *\ authtoken\ *)))
author: Florian Roth
